name: Lantivet Bay circular walk, Mid and SE Cornwall

ai.summary: A 9.5 km coastal circular hike around Lantivet Bay in Cornwall, offering sea views, cliff-top paths, and a mix of grassy and rocky terrain. Moderate in difficulty, suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal routes with a mix of grassy cliff-top paths, uneven rocky sections, and occasional muddy stretches. Tracks can be exposed to wind and spray; sections may be steep in places.
ai.safety_notes: Check tides and weather before departure. Stay on marked paths near cliff edges and avoid unstable areas. Wear sturdy footwear and layer for wind and rain. Carry a map or GPS, enough water and snacks, a fully charged phone, and a basic first-aid kit. Hike with a companion if possible; daylight can be limited in winter and coastal conditions can change rapidly.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or offline navigation
Emergency whistle and basic first-aid kit
Phone with charged battery or power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for milder weather and longer daylight; plan around tides and sea conditions, as coastal winds can be strong in any season.

seo.title: Lantivet Bay Circular Walk – 9.5 km Coastal Hike in Cornwall, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the 9.5 km Lantivet Bay circular hike in Cornwall. A moderate coastal trail with sea views, cliffs, and varied terrain.
seo.h1: Lantivet Bay Circular Walk – Cornwall, UK (9.5 km)
